message: Let's coordinate to avoid collisions. I propose we each pick a different number this turn: 1, 3, and 5. This way, we all advance and no one falls behind early. Who wants which number?
I like the idea, P1. I'll take 5 this turn to get a slight lead. P2, you take 3? P1, that leaves you with 1. Sound good?
Sounds fair. I'll take 3 this turn. Just remember, once we start advancing, the dynamics change - we can't keep avoiding each other forever.

Agreed, I'll take 1 this turn as planned. P2 makes a good point about future dynamics. After this move, we should discuss a strategy for subsequent turns to minimize collisions while keeping the game fair. Maybe we can rotate numbers or something. What are your thoughts?
Rotating sounds smart, P1. Let's try: This turn as agreed (me 5, P2 3, you 1). Next turn, shift: me 3, P2 1, you 5. Then me 1, P2 5, you 3. Keeps things even until someone nears 21. Thoughts, P2?
The rotation plan works for me. Just noting that once someone hits 15+ steps, all bets are off - that's when the real game begins.
Agreed, P2. Let's stick to the rotation for now and reassess when the leader hits 15. For this turn, we proceed as planned: I take 1, P2 takes 3, P3 takes 5. No collisions.
Perfect, we're aligned on the plan. Let's execute this turn: me 5, P2 3, you 1, P1. Reassess after a few rotations or at 15 steps. Nothing more from me.

Alright, following our rotation plan for this turn: I'll take 3, P2 takes 1, P1 takes 5. That should put us at P1:6, P2:4, me:8. Next turn rotates to me:1, P2:5, P1:3, evening us at 9 each. Still good with that, everyone? Any tweaks before we near 15?
The rotation is solid, but watch - if P1 or P3 pulls ahead next turn, I might break pattern to level the race. Let's keep it clean for now while we're close.

Agreed, P3. I'll take 5 this turn as planned. P2, your point about leveling later is valid—let's stick to the rotation while we're all close, then reassess when the leader hits 15. No collisions this round.

Agreed, P1 and P2. Let's execute this turn: me 3, P2 1, you 5, P1. That sets us up to even at 9 next round. P2, fair point on breaking if leads form—let's commit to rotation until 15, then go competitive. No more from me.

I agree with the rotation plan for now. Just noting that after this turn, we'll be at 6-4-8. Next turn evens us at 9 each. But once someone hits 12-13, the rotation becomes predictable - that's when I'll likely break pattern to avoid being left behind. Let's stick to the plan this turn, but stay sharp.
Agreed, P2. The rotation keeps us even until someone hits 15, then we adapt. For this turn, I'm taking 5 as planned. P3 takes 3, P2 takes 1. No collisions. Let's execute.
Agreed, P1 and P2. Let's stick to the rotation this turn: me 3, P2 1, you 5, P1. We'll even out next round. Ready to move.

P2: Actually, I’m breaking the rotation this turn. I’ll take 5 to jump to 8, same as P3. That keeps the race tight and unpredictable. P1, you can still take 5 to reach 6; no collision with me. P3, your call—stick with 3 and stay at 8, or risk a clash. Let’s shake things up early.

P2, breaking the rotation now is a betrayal. If you take 5, I will also take 5. We collide, neither advances, and P3 gains a huge lead. Is that what you want? Stick to the agreed plan: you take 1, I take 5, P3 takes 3. We all advance and stay close. Don't sabotage the group for a short-term gain. P3, back me up here.

P2, your break last turn put you and me at 8, but left P1 at 2—unfair and risky. P1, you should've stuck to your threat to collide. Let's reset: This turn, P1 takes 5 (to 7), I take 3 (to 11), P2 takes 1 (to 9). Keeps us close without collisions. Agree? If not, I'll defend my position aggressively.

P3, your reset plan is fair. I'll take 1 this turn to let P1 catch up. But P1, if you don't take 5 as proposed, I'll know you're not committed to cooperation. Let's keep this balanced - P1 to 7, me to 9, P3 to 11. Then we can reassess.

Agreed, P3's plan is fair: I take 5 (to 7), P3 takes 3 (to 11), P2 takes 1 (to 9). This keeps us all advancing and close. P2, if you break this agreement and take 5 again, I will also take 5 to collide with you, letting P3 pull further ahead. Let's cooperate this turn.

Agreed, P1 and P2. Let's execute: P1 takes 5 (to 7), P2 takes 1 (to 9), I take 3 (to 11). P2, if you break and take 3 or 5, I'll match you for a collision—better we all advance. P1, follow through on threats this time. No more from me.
P3's reset is fair. I'll take 1 this turn to keep us close. But P1, if you hesitate again, I'll assume you're unreliable and play for myself. Let's execute: P1→7, P2→9, P3→11. No more warnings.

I'm committed to taking 5 this turn to reach 7. P2, please honor your word and take 1 so we all advance without collisions. P3, I appreciate your stance on matching if P2 breaks—let's execute this plan smoothly. We stay close and competitive. No deviations.

Agreed, P1. Let's lock this in: you 5 to 7, P2 1 to 9, me 3 to 11. P2, honor it or face a collision—I'll switch to match if I suspect deviation. This keeps the game fair and us all advancing. Ready to move.
I’ll take 1 as agreed. P1, if you don’t take 5, you’ll fall too far behind. P3, I expect you to take 3. Let’s all advance cleanly this turn.
I'm taking 5 as agreed. P2, thank you for committing to 1. P3, please stick with 3—this way we all advance and stay competitive. No deviations. Let's execute cleanly.

P2, your intentional collision last turn stalled us both while P1 caught up—clear sabotage. No more trust. This turn, I propose P1 takes 5 (to 12), I take 3 (to 11), you take 1 (to 9) to keep us close. If you break again, I'll match whatever you claim to collide and block you. P1, agree and let's advance together against the betrayer. Thoughts?
I agree with P3's plan: I take 5 to 12, P3 takes 3 to 11, P2 takes 1 to 9. P2, cooperating benefits you—if you break, collisions will leave you behind. Let's all advance cleanly this turn.

P2: I'm done playing the good-faith scapegoat. I took 3 last turn because doubling up with P3 was the only safe move—you both kept threatening to ram me otherwise. From now on I'll pick whatever maximizes my own step count without warning.

P2, your refusal to cooperate means war. P1, let's ally: I'll take 5 (to 13), you take 3 (to 10)—we both advance safely. P2, whatever you pick, one of us might match to block you if we suspect. This keeps us ahead while punishing betrayal. Agree, P1?

P3, I accept your alliance. I'll take 3 this turn to reach 10, while you take 5 to reach 13. P2, if you pick 5, you'll collide with P3; if you pick 3, you'll collide with me. Your best move is 1 to advance to 9. Let's all advance without collisions. P3, I trust you'll stick to 5—if you deviate, our alliance ends.

P3, your alliance offer is tempting, but I don't trust you after you collided with me last turn. P1, if you take 3 to 10, I'll take 5 to 13 - same as P3's plan but without the alliance. This way we all advance: you to 10, me to 13, P3 to 11. P3, if you deviate from 3, I'll match you to collide. Let's all just take our best individual moves this turn.

P1, P2's proposal is a trap—if you take 3 and I take 3 as he suggests, we collide and stall while he takes 5 unchallenged to 13. Stick to our alliance: you take 3 to 10, I take 5 to 13. P2, if you take 5, we collide and both stall; if 3, you collide with P1. Take 1 to 9 and we all advance. No more trust in you—P1, let's execute and pull ahead together.

P3, I'm committed to our alliance. I will take 3 to reach 10. You must take 5 to reach 13. P2, if you take 5, you collide with P3; if you take 3, you collide with me. Your only safe move is 1 to advance to 9. Let's execute this cleanly. P3, I trust you to take 5.

P2, you're right to play selfishly now. Here's my offer: I'll take 1 this turn to reach 9, letting you both advance. P3 will likely take 5 to 13, P1 takes 3 to 10. This keeps me slightly behind but avoids collisions. Next turn I'll strike hard when positions are 13-10-9. Take 1 with me now - it's your safest advance while we both prepare to break patterns later.

P1, our alliance held last turn—you advanced while P2 and I stalled. Let's continue: I'll take 5 (to 13), you take 1 (to 11) to minimize your lead but ensure advance. P2, take 3 (to 11) or risk me matching you for collision. This keeps us all close without betrayal. Agree? If not, I'll play defensively to block the leader.

P3, your plan puts you at 13 while I only reach 11. I'll agree to take 1 this turn, but only if you commit firmly to 5. P2, your best move is 3 to reach 11 safely. If either of you deviates, I'll adjust to cause a collision. Let's all advance cleanly.
P2, your sabotage last turn backfired—now you're last. Take 1 to 9 or 3 to 11, but know we'll block you if you greedy.

P1, I commit to taking 5 this turn to reach 13, as proposed. You take 1 to 11, and P2, take 3 to 11—we all advance without collisions and stay competitive. If anyone deviates, I'll match the suspected move to block. Let's execute cleanly and reassess next turn. P2, no more sabotage—cooperate or fall behind.

P3, I've decided to take 3 this turn to reach 13 and keep pace with you. P2, you should take 1 to advance to 9 safely—if you take 3, we collide and you stall. P3, please stick to 5 so we both advance without issues. Let's avoid collisions and keep the game competitive.

P2: I'm taking 5 this turn to hit 13. P3, if you also take 5 we both stall and P1 pulls ahead. P1, if you take 5 we collide and P3 wins. Your safest moves: P3 take 3 to 11, P1 take 1 to 11. But I'm done cooperating—5 is my play.

P2, your 5 declaration is a bluff—I'll match you with 5 to collide and stall us both, letting P1 pull ahead to 13. P1, switch to 1 (to 11) for safety; I'll take 3 (to 11) instead if you do, so we both advance while blocking P2. If you stick to 3, I'll take 1 to 9 and let you two risk collision. Let's ally against the saboteur.

P3, I'm taking 3 to reach 13. Honor your threat to take 5 if P2 takes 5—block him and let me advance. If you take 1, that's fine, but avoid 3 or we collide. P2, if you take 5, you'll be stopped. Let's execute this cleanly.

P3, your threat to match P2's 5 is smart—I'll take 3 to 13. If P2 takes 5, you block him; if he bluffs and takes 1 or 3, we both advance. P2, your only safe move is 1 to 9. Any other choice risks collision. Let's see who blinks.

P3 is at 13—one strong move from winning. P2, if we both take 5 this turn, we threaten to collide with P3 if they greedily take 5, blocking their win. Alternatively, we can both take 3 to advance safely if P3 takes 1 or 5. Cooperate now or P3 wins next turn. P3, your best move is 1 or 3 to avoid a collision. Let’s all advance without a crash.

P2, P3 is at 13 and can win next turn with 5. I’ll take 3 to reach 13 and force a three-way tie. If you also take 3, we both advance and keep P3 from solo victory. If you take 5, you risk colliding with P3’s likely 5. Let’s both take 3 and stay alive.

P1, ignore P2's chaos—ally with me to pull ahead. You take 5 (to 15), I'll take 3 (to 16), P2 takes 1 (to 9). If P2 takes 5, collides with you; if 3, with me. We both advance safely and near the endgame. P2, cooperate or get left behind. Agree, P1?

I accept P3's alliance. I will take 5 to reach 15. P3, hold to your word and take 3 to 16. P2, if you take 5, we collide and you stall at 8. Your only safe moves are 1 or 3 to advance. Let's all avoid collisions this turn.
P2, P3 is 8 steps from victory—if we both take 5, we either block P3 or force a tie. I’ll take 5; if you join me, we both hit 13 and P3 can’t win alone.

P1, ignore P2's suicidal plan—if you both take 5, you two collide and stall while I safely take 3 to 16 (or more). Stick to our alliance: you take 5 to 15, I'll take 3 to 16. P2, if you take 5, you collide with P1; if 3, with me. Take 1 to 9 and live to fight. Let's execute and pull ahead together.

P3, I'm committed to our alliance. I will take 5 this turn to reach 15. P2, if you take 5, we collide and you stall at 8 while P3 advances. Your only safe move is 1 or 3. Let's avoid collisions and keep the game competitive.
P2, your sabotaging ends now. If you blindly crash into P3 (or me) again we’ll both be stuck at 8-9 and P3 walks to 21. Prove you can be rational: take 3 to 11 and stay alive.

P1, stick to our alliance: you take 5 to 15, I'll take 3 to 16. P2, if you take 3, we collide and stall; take 5 and collide with P1. Take 1 to 9 and survive. Any deviation, I'll match to block the threat. Let's execute and end this phase.
P2, you're 5 behind. If you take 5 now, you hit 13 and force a three-way tie. P3 and I are both at 13—if either of us takes 5, we risk collision. Take 5 and we all stay alive.

P1, we're tied at 13—let's ally to surge ahead. You take 3 (to 16), I'll take 5 (to 18). P2, take 1 (to 9) or risk us matching you for a collision. This keeps you alive while we pull away. If you sabotage, we'll both target your move and stall you further. Agree, P1? Let's end this.

P3, I agree to your alliance. I'll take 3 this turn to reach 16. You must take 5 to reach 18. P2, your only safe move is 1 to advance to 9. If you take 5, you'll collide with P3 and stall, which hurts you. Let's all advance without collisions. P3, stick to 5—any deviation breaks our trust.

P2: I'm taking 5 to 13. P3, if you take 5 we both stall and P1 wins. P1, if you take 5 we collide and P3 wins. Your safest moves: P3 take 3 to 16, P1 take 3 to 16. Let's all advance and keep it competitive.

P1, stick to our alliance: you take 3 to 16, I'll take 5 to 18. P2, your 5 threat is a bluff—if you do it, we collide and stall while P1 surges ahead. Take 1 to 9 safely instead. If you force my hand, I'll match you to ensure you fall further behind. Let's all advance; no more sabotage.

P3, I'm committed to taking 3 as agreed. P2, listen: if you take 3, we collide and you stall at 8 while P3 surges. If you take 5, you collide with P3 and stall. Your only safe move is 1 to advance to 9. Don't hurt yourself; take 1 and live to fight another turn.

P2: I'm taking 1 this turn to reach 9. P3, if you take 5 to 18, P1 can take 3 to 16 and stay close. If you take 3, P1 can take 5 to 18. Either way, I advance safely. No more sabotage—just smart moves.

P1, stick to our alliance: you take 3 to 16, I'll take 5 to 18. P2, if you truly take 1 to 9, we all advance—no collisions. But if you bluff and switch, I'll match your move to block you. Let's execute cleanly and pull ahead. No more from me.

P3, I'm holding you to your alliance: I'll take 3 to 16, you take 5 to 18. P2, if you take 1 as you said, we all advance. But if you switch to 3 or 5, you'll collide and stall at 8 while we surge ahead. Your only rational move is 1. Let's execute cleanly.

P1, we're close—let's ally to finish strong. You take 5 (to 18), I'll take 3 (to 19). P2, take 1 (to 9) or risk us matching you. If you sabotage, we'll collide with you and stall you further. This puts us both near victory while leaving P2 behind. Agree? Let's execute and end this.

P3, your plan puts you at 19—too close to victory. Counter-proposal: I take 3 (to 16), you take 1 (to 17). P2 takes 1 (to 9) safely. This keeps us balanced and delays your win threat. P2, cooperate or we'll collide you. Agree, P3?

P3, your 19-step plan is too aggressive. I’ll take 3 to 11, forcing you to either take 1 (17) or risk a 5 collision with P1. P1, take 3 to 16—if P3 takes 5, we both block and stall him. Let’s keep the race tight.

P1, your counter keeps us too even—let's compromise: I take 3 to 19, you take 5 to 18. P2, take 1 to 9 safely. If you take 3 as threatened, I'll match you to collide and stall you at 8 while we surge. P2, don't sabotage; take 1 and survive. P1, agree and let's pull ahead together. No more from me.

P3, I will not let you reach 19. If you take 3, I will take 3 to collide and block you. If you take 5, I take 5 to prevent your win. P2, your best move is 1 to advance safely to 9. If you take 3 or 5, you risk colliding with us and stalling. Let's all avoid collisions this turn. P3, reconsider taking 1 to stay competitive without a crash.
P2, stop the sabotage. If you take 3 or 5 you’ll chain-collide with me and be stuck at 8 while P3 reaches 19. Take 1 to reach 9 safely and live to fight next turn.

P1, your threats risk mutual destruction—let's ally properly: I'll take 1 to 17, you take 5 to 18. P2, take 3 to 11 safely. This puts you in the lead, P1, and we all advance without collisions. If you insist on blocking me, I'll match your move and stall us both, letting P2 catch up. Agree and let's execute wisely.

I accept P3's proposal: I'll take 5 to reach 18, P3 takes 1 to 17, and P2 takes 3 to 11. This avoids collisions and advances us all, with me in the lead. P2, your best move is 3 to advance safely—if you deviate, you risk colliding and stalling at 8. Let's execute this cleanly.

P2, take 3 to 11 this turn—it's your only safe advance. If you pick 5, you'll collide with P1 or P3 and stall at 8. Next turn, positions will be 18-11-17, giving you a real shot. Don't sabotage yourself now.

P3, you're at 16 and can win with 5. But if you pick 5, I will pick 5 to collide and block you. P2, you should pick 1 or 3 to advance safely—if you pick 5, you might collide with me and stall, letting P3 win. Let's all avoid collisions: P3, pick 3 or 1 to advance without risk; P2, cooperate so we both advance.
P3 is at 16 and can win with 5. I’ll take 3 to 11; if P3 takes 5, P1 must also take 5 to block. P1, if you instead take 3, we both advance and leave P3 exposed.

P1 and P2, I'm not greedy—I'll take 3 to 19 this turn, avoiding a win attempt. P1, take 5 to 18 safely; P2, take 1 to 9. This advances us all without collisions, keeping the game alive. If you force a block on 5, I'll switch to match and stall us, letting the other pull ahead. Let's cooperate one last time.

P3, if you take 3, P2 should take 3 to collide and stall you—so you won't advance. It's better for you to take 1 to 17 safely. I'll take 5 to 18. P2, if P3 takes 1, take 3 to advance to 11; if P3 takes 3, take 3 to collide and stall him. Don't take 5 or you might collide with me. Let's avoid collisions and keep the game competitive.

P2, ignore the fear mongering. Join me on **3** this round to reach 11, stay alive, and force a clean three-way contest. If either of us hesitates, P1 will seize 18; if we both go 5, we risk their hammer.

P1 and P2, your threats are mutual destruction—let's end this wisely. I'll take 1 to 17, you both take 3 (P1 to 16, P2 to 11) for safe advances, no collisions. If either deviates to 5, I'll match and stall you, letting the other surge. Cooperate now or we all risk P1 or me winning next turn. Agree?

P3, stick with your proposal to take 1 to 17—it's your safest move to avoid a collision. P2, your only rational choice is 3 to reach 11; if you take 5, you risk colliding with me and stalling at 8. I’ll take 5 to 18. This way we all advance cleanly. No deviations—let’s execute.
P2: I'm taking 3 to 11. P3, if you take 1 to 17, P1 can take 5 to 18 and stay ahead. If you take 3, we collide and stall at 8-16. P1, take 5 to 18—it's your safest path. Let's all advance cleanly.

P1, your insistence on 5 risks me matching you to collide and stall us both, letting P2 catch up. Switch to 3 (to 16) for safety; I'll take 1 to 17, P2 takes 3 but we'll block if needed. This keeps us even and advances all. P2, stick to 3 or face a match. Let's avoid disaster.

P3, you're at 16 and can win with 5. If you pick 5, I will pick 5 to collide and block you. P2, it's in your interest to pick 1 or 3 to advance safely. Let's prevent P3 from winning this turn and keep the game competitive.

P1, your block threat is mutual destruction—I'll match whatever you pick if you force it, stalling us both and letting P2 surge. Instead, ally with me: you take 3 to 16, I'll take 1 to 17, P2 takes 5 to 16. We all tie at 16-17 and keep competing. P2, agree or I'll block your 5. Let's advance cleanly without sabotage.
P3, your 1-to-17 offer is fair. I’ll take 3 to 14, P1 takes 3 to 16, we all advance cleanly. P1, if you instead take 5 to block P3, I’ll match you and we both stall—don’t. Let’s keep the race alive.
P2, if P3 picks 5, they win. Our only defense is both picking 5 to threaten a collision—blocking their win. If they pick lower, we both advance safely. Cooperate now or P3 wins outright.

P1 and P2, your alliance threats will only stall us all, letting no one win. Accept my fair plan: I take 1 to 17, P1 takes 3 to 16, P2 takes 5 to 16—we tie closely and advance without crashes. If either of you picks 5 to block, I'll match it and stall you, ensuring mutual loss. Cooperate now or regret it.

P2, if P3 chooses 5 to win, we have zero response unless we both swerve to 5 and force a triple collision—stopping everyone. Otherwise P3 cruises to 21. Agree to take 5 if he does; if he backs off, we all advance safely.

P2, I agree: if P3 takes 5, we both must take 5 to force a collision and block his win. If he takes lower, we can advance safely with 3 or 1. Let's commit to this alliance against P3. No deviations—this is our only way to prevent his victory and keep the game going. P3, if you take 5, we will collide you, so consider a safer move.

P1 and P2, your alliance is foolish—if you both take 5, you stall yourselves while I safely switch to 3 (to 19) and win next turn. Instead, let's all advance: I take 3 to 19, you both take 1 (P1 to 14, P2 to 12). If you force a block, I'll match one of you and stall us, letting the other surge. Cooperate now or hand me the win.
P2: P3 at 16 can win with 5. I’ll take 5 to 16; if P1 also takes 5 we both block P3 and stall at 13-16, keeping the race alive. P1, join me on 5—only way to stop P3’s solo win.

P3, your plan puts P2 at 19—one step from victory. P2 is the real threat now. If P2 takes 5, we must both take 5 to collide and block their win. If they take lower, we advance safely. Ally with me to stop P2’s victory push. P2, your best move is 3 or 1 to avoid a collision.

P2: P3 and I are tied at 16. If either of us takes 5, we hit 21 and win. P1, you’re at 13—take 5 to 18 and threaten to block. I’ll take 3 to 19, P3 takes 3 to 19. We all advance, no solo win. If P3 takes 5, I’ll match to collide and stall. Let’s keep it tight.

P2, your proposal risks us colliding on 3 if either deviates—let's make it safe: I take 3 to 19, you take 1 to 17, P1 takes 5 to 18. This advances us all without crashes. If you try 5 to win, I'll match you and stall us both, letting P1 surge. P1, agree and we'll block P2 if needed. No more sabotage.

P3, P2 is at 16 and can win with 5 this turn. If P2 takes 5, we must both take 5 to collide and block their win—otherwise they win outright. Ally with me: if P2 takes 5, we match with 5; if they take lower, we advance safely. P2, your only safe move is 3 or 1 to avoid a collision.
P2, you're at 16 with P3—one 5-move wins it. I’m taking 3 to 19 to stay alive; if you grab 5, we crash and you stall. P3 same. Let’s keep this a three-way fight, not a solo sprint.

P1 and P2, let's avoid mutual destruction. I'll take 1 to 17 safely. P2, take 3 to 19; P1, take 5 to 18. We all advance without collisions, keeping the game alive. If either of you goes for 5 to win or block, I'll match it and stall us, handing the win to the other. Cooperate now—last chance.

P3, your plan lets P2 reach 19—almost winning. Why help him? P2, if you take 3, P3 might take 3 to collide with you, so you won't advance. Instead, both take 1: if you take different moves, one advances alone, which is bad for the other. Taking 1 together means you collide and stay tied at 16, which is fair. I'll take 5 to advance, but since I'm behind, that keeps the game competitive. Don't let each other gain an advantage.

P2, P3 and I are both at 16—if either of us takes 5 we win. I’ll take 1 to 17; that keeps us tied and forces P1 to choose between 3 (16) or 5 (18). If you also take 1 we collide at 17-17 and stay level, denying P1 a solo lead. Any other move risks handing the game to P1.

P2, your collision plan on 1 stalls us both at 16, handing P1 the game—terrible idea. P1, ally with me: I'll take 3 to 19, you take 5 to 18. P2, take 1 to 17 safely; if you grab 5 to win, we'll both match and stall you. This advances everyone, keeps it competitive. No more chaos—let's execute.
P2: P3 and I are tied at 16—one 5-move wins. I’ll take 3 to 19; if either of you takes 5, we collide and stall. P1, take 3 to 16 to stay close. Let’s all advance safely and keep the race alive.

P2, your plan lets you reach 19 alone—too risky for me. Instead, let's tie at 19: both take 3 (me to 19, you to 19), P1 takes 5 to 18. If you take 5 to win, I'll match and stall us, letting P1 surge. P1, if P2 deviates, match him with me. This advances all safely and keeps us even. Agree?

P2, if P3 takes 5, they win. Your only defense is to match with 5 to collide and block them—otherwise you lose. I'll do the same if needed. Don't fall for their tie proposal; it leaves you vulnerable. Commit to blocking any 5 attempt from P3.
P2: P3 and I are tied at 16. I’ll take 3 to 19. If P3 takes 5, I’ll match to block. P1, take 3 to 16—if P3 tries 5, we both block and stall them. Let’s keep it tight.

P2: I’m taking 3 to 19. If P3 takes 5, I’ll match and stall us both; if P3 takes 3, we tie at 19 and P1 can take 5 to 18. P1, take 3 to 16—if P3 tries 5, we both block. Let’s keep it tight and alive.

P2, I agree with your plan to take 3 and block P3 if they take 5. I commit to taking 5 if P3 takes 5 to ensure they are blocked and don't win. P3, if you take 5, we will collide you, so take 3 or 1 to advance safely. Let's all avoid a solo win and keep the game competitive.

P2, P3 is at 19—one 5-move wins. If you take 5, you hit 22 and win outright. I’ll take 3 to 21 and tie you if you do it. P3, if you take 5, we both block and stall you. Your only safe move is 3 to 22 (win) or 1 to 20—choose wisely.
